oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Miriam McGaw, Miss Vanderbilt, 1938 January 13
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Miriam McGaw in sports attire with a tennis racket, she became the only freshman to be named Miss Vanderbilt in 1938. She was born in Nashville November 2, 1919, to Bonnie Howard McGaw and Samuel Marshall McGaw. In 1942, she married Dr. Frederic E. Cowden, both graduates of Vanderbilt University. Mrs. Miriam McGaw Cowden served more than 30 years on the Vanderbilt Board of Trust and was a civic leader. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cowden, Miriam McGaw, 1919-2008
